meanings.sent1: The rope was tauter than a drum skin.
meanings.sent2: She made sure the bedsheet was tauter before tucking it in.
meanings.sent3: The tauter the elastic band, the higher the pitch when plucked.
meanings.sent4: His tauter nerves made him jump at the slightest sound.
meanings.sent5: The tauter the wire, the louder the twang when released.

meanings.definition: To make or become tight or taut
meanings.sent1: He tautered the strings of his guitar before the performance.
meanings.sent2: The sailor tautered the sails to catch the wind efficiently.
meanings.sent3: She tautered the ribbon around the gift box with precision.
meanings.sent4: The chef tautered the dough to ensure a perfect crust.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast tautered the balance beam before her routine.
